parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To call together. From sun and kaleo; to convoke.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.
A neighbor. From ge; a neighbour; by implication, a friend.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To rejoice with, congratulate. From sun and chairo; to sympathize in gladness, congratulate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
